posts.post_content:
Back off, she's gonna blow! :O  
  
I love these flavorful Izzet cards. They build these crazy contraptions that are potentially powerful, but unstable enough so there's always a chance it'll (literally) blow up in your face.   
  
The same part of me that loves playing with [Goblin Test Pilot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Test Pilot) loves playing with this card. Except this card is actually decent. Well, at least it's decent in RTR Limited. Sure, sometimes it'll blow up in your face, but if you set it up right (which isn't that hard to do), it can set up some awkward combat situations for your opponent (not unlike [Creepy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Creepy Doll) in ISD Limited). They don't really wanna take 4, but they don't really want this crappy contraption to nuke their board either ... hmmm ...  
  
Cool card. :) 4.5/5

posts.post_content:
I freaking love this card. We definitely need more like it!   
  
So much fun!   
  
I laugh out loud every time I play it, in giddy anticipation of its potential. I smirk at my opponents' sighs and moans.

Posted By: wheeledgoat (8/12/2013 2:32:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Very fun, especially in multiplayer. People will either kill it because they're behind or protect it because they're ahead. He's virtually unblockable against tribal decks with an establish board position and he's a restraint for decks who are ahead who wish to attack, as they may get wiped for it.   
  
Stalls, might wipe, and is above the curve on size anyway.

posts.post_content:
@SirLibraryEater: Lifelink is an awesome idea. [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of Orzhova) and the new [Whip of Erebos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whip of Erebos) seem to be the best ways to link it up. I'm going to use it with [Cutthroat Maneuver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cutthroat Maneuver), too, but that's a little less useful. I'll have to cast the Maneuver before the first coin flip, because the Rig could be sacrificed immediately after the first coin flip with no chance to respond. I'll only have a 1-in-4 chance of gaining massive life, so I prolly wont be casting the Maneuver if the Rig is my only creature. I might tho. I'll be using it in a deck with Gorgons (five or more toughness) and tons of fight (synergistic with the Rig and the Gorgon's deathtouch and high toughness).  
  
Your inclusion of Palisade Giant is interesting. I guess it's good if you just want to beat face with a 4/4 trampler, but your Rig won't blow up very easily if it's never damaged. If it ever does blow up, everything will be protected, exept for your poor Giant, a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
"Whoops, I accidentally the board."  
  
Just imagine the deck that could be made, centered around this and giving it lifelink.  
CREATURES  
4x [Volatile Rig](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volatile Rig)(of course)  
4x [Vizkopa Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vizkopa Guildmage)  
4x [Boros Reckoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Reckoner)  
4x [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll)  
2x [Armored Transport](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armored Transport)  
SPELLS  
4x [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of Orzhova)  
4x [Mark of the Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mark of the Vampire)  
4x [Moment of Heroism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moment of Heroism)  
4x [Swift Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swift Justice)  
2x [Homicidal Seclusion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Homicidal Seclusion)  
LANDS  
4x [Vault of the Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vault of the Archangel)  
2x [Cavern of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern of Souls)  
2x [Godless Shrine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Godless Shrine)  
1x [Sacred Foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacred Foundry)  
1x [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain)  
7x [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp)  
7x  [Plains](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Plains)  
  
And all that is just in Standard.  
  
-UPDATE-  
I actually got around to making a deck like this, because I came across some cards that I found helpful. Here's the actual, for-reals... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
